alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern El Paso County through 545 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Bliss, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Central El Paso, East El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Fort Bliss, Homestead Meadows, Montana Vista, Biggs Field, and Fort Bliss Northeast. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas near mile marker 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
